b'@sk3ywulff Hi Marcel. Thanks for the heads-up. Rovi recently sold the DivX business, but I will let them know about the issue.'
b"Many thanks to Colin Dixon @nScreenMedia and Mike Grebb @CableFAX for today's successful entertainment metadata webinar. #MetaD"
b'"Rovi has tens-of-thousands of sources of entertainment metadata. We re-write descriptions from a neutral perspective." --Priya R. #MetaD'
b'"Companies like Rovi have been building their databases for years. It\'s not for the faint-of-heart."  --Colin Dixon @nScreenMedia #MetaD'
b'"It is incredibly difficult to pull together an entertainment metadata database." --Colin Dixon @nScreenMedia #MetaD'
b'"Integrating commerce opportunities into metadata tags is more prevalent today in Europe than in the USA." --Priya Rajagopalan #MetaD'
b'"The amount of information in any given video is huge." --Colin Dixon @nScreenMedia #MetaD'
b'"There is a role for tying metadata to commerce, as long as it doesn\'t disrupt the viewing experience." --Colin Dixon @nScreenMedia #MetaD'
b'"Rovi metadata matches descriptors to EIDR I.D.s. In five years, EIDR should become the global standard."  --Priya Rajagopalan #MetaD'
b'"Rovi was one of the cofounders of EIDR. Most major studios and entertainment tech companies have adopted." --Priya Rajagopalan #MetaD'
b'"Metadata databases change over time. Not just growing, but the records themselves are modified as they happen."  --Colin Dixon #MetaD'
b'"We decompose natural language tags to make sense of them, then tie them to descriptive tags to deliver accurate search results." #MetaD'
b'"Using a knowledge graph, we can have a complete picture of what the consumer is looking for based on their consumption patterns." #MetaD'
b'"We understand the differences between context: Chicago the film vs. Chicago the band vs. Chicago the baseball team."  -- Priya R. #MetaD'
b'"We just bolstered our capabilities with our acquisition last month of Veveo."  --Priya Rajagopalan  #MetaD'
b'"Editorial is a big part of what we do. Rovi has more than 400 editors who generate data in 15 languages."  --Priya Rajagopalan  #MetaD'
b'"Metadata impacts viewer experience. Rovi has the largest repository of metadata across the world." --Priya Rajagopalan #MetaD'
b'"Being found is the defining issue for content providers today. To do that, step 1 is getting advanced metadata."  --Colin Dixon #MetaD'
b'"Great content is no longer the exclusive domain of pay-TV providers."  --Colin Dixon @nScreenMedia #MetaD'
b'"50% of what we watch will be on demand by 2020. Quality content can be found online."  --Colin Dixon @nScreenMedia #MetaD'
b'"Metadata doesn\'t solve a problem in the past. It is essential. Without great metadata, we\'ll struggle to find content." -- C. Dixon #MetaD'
b'"Genres and moods allow us to decompose complex requests, e.g. \'Show me movies like Shawshank Redemption.\' " --Colin Dixon #MetaD'
b'"I was very impressed w/the natural language processing demonstrated by Veveo, which was recently acquired by Rovi."  --Colin Dixon #MetaD'
b'"Natural language processing requires a dynamic database of information."  --Colin Dixon @nScreenMedia #MetaD'
b'"Because perceptions change, the way we remember them change with them."  --Colin Dixon @nScreenMedia #MetaD'
b'"Voice control appears in Samsung, LG TVs, Xbox for some time, and even Amazon Fire TV includes voice search."  --Colin Dixon #MetaD'
b'"Metadata must be continuously updated and improved."  --Colin Dixon @nScreenMedia #MetaD'
b'"Perceptions, actions and reactions change over time. All of these impact metadata."  --Colin Dixon @nScreenMedia #MetaD'
b'"Without the breadth/depth of metadata, static information isn\'t enough. Data changes over time."  --Colin Dixon @nScreenMedia #MetaD'
b'"We\'re at an inflection point, moving from Nielsen-style ratings to needing real-time metadata updates." --Colin Dixon @nScreenMedia #MetaD'
b'"Metadata is \'Big Data.\' " --Colin Dixon @nScreenMedia #MetaD'
b'"Searching for a celebrity can potentially touch hundreds of thousands of metadata records."  --Colin Dixon @nScreenMedia #MetaD'
b'"Consumers want robust usable TV/movie search capabilities, but most say they don\'t have access to it."  --Colin Dixon @nScreenMedia #MetaD'
b'"53% of consumers want TV/movie recommendations based on their personal preferences."  --Colin Dixon @nScreenMedia #MetaD'
b'"Growth of online pay services is outstripping VOD. One reason is ease of use."  --Colin Dixon @nScreenMedia #MetaD'
b'"Pay-per-view is healthy. 12% of subscribers rent one PPV movie per month, but it could be much greater." --Colin Dixon  #MetaD'
b'"The depth consumer expect from television guides today is much greater than the humble guides of yesterday." --Colin Dixon #MetaD'
b'"The view consumers have had about TV shows has been the same for 25 years, but it\'s changing today."  -- Colin Dixon  #MetaD'

b"And that's it for our live-tweeting of the #DigitalHollywood NextGen Home Entertainment panel. Thanks for reading and retweeting!"
b'Predictions? Peter Hoddie: Much more adoption of open standards. Ian Greenblatt: Monetization of multiscreen.'
b'Predictions? Bob Shallow: We need to see more personalization driven by metadata injected with analytics.'
b'Marty Roberts: We need to come up to that higher level of always working.'
b'Marty Roberts: We came up on fault-tolerant Internet users, but Comcast explained that video not playing meant a $5 call or $90 truck roll.'
b"Sam Vasisht: As long as the cable co's get the large subscription $, they will get the calls. It's a double-edged sword."
b"Steve McKay: It's incredibly intensive to get things working, with dozens of engineers, then something moves and it stops working."
b'Question: If I have an issue with my playback, who do I call? Ian Greenblatt: Ppl call the cable co, or the set top box manufacturer.'
b'Ian Greenblatt: I think smart TVs are great. We have smart TVs and a dumber pipe. We need smart TVs and a smarter pipe.'
b'Peter Hoddie: If you put standards on there, things will still work and will continue to receive new content.'
b'Steve McKay, Entone: Your TV should be the best display in your home. The other stuff should not be in it. Smart TVs are a dumb idea.'
b'Marty Roberts: Smart companies are investing in the optionality of working with multiple devices.'
b'Marty Roberts: Pushing to the cloud lets you talk to any device, but requires you to have a much more agile back end than was needed before.'
b'Bob Shallow: You can replace the legacy guide with HTML guide and still control legacy set top box, but experience is radically different.'
b'Bob Shallow: Any service provider wants to cut costs. If you push things to the cloud, you can replace legacy guides without hardware.'
b"Hugo Swart: one doesn't buy a TV for just a year or two. The set top box can be the means to upgrade."
b"Ian Greenblatt: We've not seen the end of appointment television. Time-shifting has made it convenient but water cooler moments aren't over."
b'Ian Greenblatt: Being able to touch the content is a pretty big deal. It turns the lean-back, spoonfed experience into an interaction.'
b'Ian Greenblatt: We need to empower networks and make them smarter.'
b'Ian Greenblatt: Someone told me they have 100 IP addresses in their house. In the Internet of things, that will not be unusual.'
b'Ian Greenblatt: iPhones came only in 2007 - not a long time ago. Set-top boxes are experiencing a similar evolution.'
b"Peter Hoddie: We're out to design consumer experiences, not consumer devices. And all these hv 2 work together - multidevice home experience"
b'Bob Shallow: There are over 100 pieces of information for each listing in our metadata, most enhanced by specialist editors.'
b'Bob Shallow: Another 30% of our business is metadata. We use unique identifiers for artists, albums, songs, etc. Human editors are essential'
b'Bob Shallow: Our priorities are taking core services like legacy cable services and pushing them into the cloud.'

b'And that\'s today\'s panel on Guiding "Tune-In" Through Discovery! Thanks for following along. #S3CES #CES2014'
b'.@jtoeman an useful application of social likes is finding a show a lot if your friends like on FB & putting it one click away.'
b"What about social tuning? Charles Dawes of @RoviCorp: Ppl have always talked about shows, even before social. Now it's about the right time."
b'.@nScreenMedia asks the audience: How many ppl channel-surfed this weekend? (Many hands.)'
b'.@DsmithsBen: The way people might want to watch the content will probably differ according to the device.'
b'Jimshade: We want people to find shows any way they want, but we want them to view it on @dish.'
b'.@jtoeman: We need to make it easy for a user to send to another user all that they need to just click and watch.'
b'.@jtoeman: Ppl want to be entertained, ppl don\'t want to have to work. Viewer finds a show they like, tells another = "actionable share."'
b'.@nScreenMedia: Another question - how do we remove barriers for those trying to watch? @hardie: I like the barriers, like to channel-surf!'
b'.@nScreenMedia: All these tools are nothing without the data. How do you collect all this data from their disparate sources?'
b".@hardie There's much more pressure on new shows to find an audience right away, so we need all the tools to drive viewers to watch/DVR it."
b'.@jtoeman The average user who sets up a RemindMe reminder sets up 3 more reminders that week.'
b'.jtoeman: Our product NextGuide has a RemindMe function that @FOXTV (for example) can use on their site to let users set TV reminders.'
b'Charles Dawes: We can also link music, movie, and TV data so you can build new discovery experiences where they cross, such as with Glee.'
b'Charles Dawes: Rovi spans from traditional cable boxes to the tablet experience. Our challenge is to make the data fit the purpose. #S3CES'
b'Jimshade: 80% of ppl who use an app to find something to watch tune in, 20% set a recording. #S3CES'
b'Jimshade Chaudhari of @dish: our 2nd screen apps are DISH Anywhere and DISH Explore. We want ppl to find the most relevant content to them.'
b'.@hardie: At Fox we try to support viewership through digital platforms in a vast number of ways.'
